instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00923 crashes on battery, on charger all fine
threads.message:
Client had repaired liquid damage in some other shop.
They replaced battery and on the board I can see liquid damage around:
UB600, J5260, QV300, UB300

When on battery there are random restarts with kernel panic.
"*** Panic Report ***
panic(cpu 0 caller 0xffffff801f342836): nvme: "AppleS3XController. Loss of MMIO space. Write. ID=0xffffffff ARG1=0xffffffff ARG2=0xffffffff ARG3=0xffffffff EDD0=0xffffffff EDD1=0xffffffff EDD2=0xffffffff EDD3=0xffffffff EDD4=0xffffffff EDD5=0xffffffff EDD6=0xffffffff EDD7=0xffffffff NANDV=0x2, DRAMV=0x1, SSDC=256G.\n" @IONVMeController.cpp:6053
Panicked task 0xffffff854c2516a0: 188 threads: pid 0: kernel_task"

When on charger then all works fine even during CPU stress test.

Tried with know battery and got the same issue.

Any idea?

threads.title: 820-00923 crashes on battery, on charger all fine
threads.message:
Any error pops up starting in diagnostic mode (battery connected)?
The best option is testing with known good ORIGINAL battery (even old one).

threads.title: 820-00923 crashes on battery, on charger all fine
threads.message:
No error in diagnostic mode (battery connected).

Tested with original used battery and same issue.

One thing which is not right and dont know if it will be related:
J3300/47 USBC_XA_D2R_P<2>in diode mode 0.004 and should be around 0.330

threads.title: 820-00923 crashes on battery, on charger all fine
threads.message:
D3326 is the first suspect; remove it and check again.
If still short, bad U2800.
